prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35"]
prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]

raw.proposer:
{
  "selected_names": ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35"],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "score_preset": "balanced",
  "force_debate": true,
  "debate_margin": 0.05,
  "rationale": "High model disagreement (relative spread mean 0.275) and varying horizon winners suggest combining robust aggregation (baseline_mean), per-horizon selection (best_per_horizon_by_validation), and adaptive weighting (inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35) to balance stability and adaptability."
}

proposer.rationale: High model disagreement (relative spread mean 0.275) and varying horizon winners suggest combining robust aggregation (baseline_mean), per-horizon selection (best_per_horizon_by_validation), and adaptive weighting (inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35) to balance stability and adaptability.

skeptic.rationale: Current inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 shows instability (RMSE_std_over_rmse=0.408). Adding ridge_stacking_l250_topk5 (universe leader) with recommended knobs (trim_ratio=0.2, l2=50, shrinkage=0.35) improves stability while maintaining competitive performance.

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Top-performing stacking model in universe leaderboard with strong stability

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: Recommended stronger trimming for few-window stability

changes.name: baseline_mean
changes.reason: Increased shrinkage aligns with recommended knobs for regularization

skeptic.when_good: When window count is low (n_windows=3) and model instability is critical

statistician.rationale: Current best model (ridge_stacking_l250_topk5) shows instability with RMSE_std=1049. Recommended knobs suggest increasing shrinkage to 0.35 and trim_ratio to 0.2 for better stability. Adding inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35 (which already uses shrinkage=0.35) aligns with recommended parameters. Removing baseline_mean improves packet quality as it ranks last.

changes.name: baseline_mean
changes.reason: Lower performance compared to stacking models and recommended to remove for better robustness

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Recommended shrinkage of 0.35 for small n_windows (3) to improve stability

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Recommended trim_ratio of 0.2 for better outlier handling

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: Applying recommended shrinkage to improve stability

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: Applying recommended trim_ratio for better robustness

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small (3) and model stability is critical, with recommended knobs for shrinkage and trim_ratio
